Material used.Description: Recombinant proteins were overexpressed in Escherichia coli and purified for CD spectroscopy.

Readout description.Result Description: The L166P mutant shows a drastic decrease in secondary structure content and no cooperative unfolding transition, indicating severe destabilization and unfolding.
The E64D mutant spectrum is nearly identical to wild-type, indicating minimal structural perturbation.
The M26I mutant shows decreased secondary structure content and reduced thermodynamic stability with a melting temperature 8°C below wild-type.
The A104T mutant shows decreased secondary structure content and reduced thermodynamic stability with a melting temperature 8°C below wild-type.

The D149A mutant shows decreased secondary structure content, with the most pronounced effect among the intermediate mutants, and reduced thermodynamic stability with a melting temperature 8°C below wild-type.

Technical replicates.Description: All CD spectra and melting curves were acquired in at least two independent measurements to ensure reproducibility.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a reference for comparison with mutants.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: CD signal at 222 nm similar to wild-type with a melting temperature around 77°C.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant decrease in CD signal at 222 nm and/or melting temperature significantly below 77°C.

Material used.Description: Recombinant proteins were overexpressed in Escherichia coli, isotopically labeled, and purified for NMR studies.

Readout description.Result Description: The L166P mutant shows poor dispersion in HSQC spectra, indicating a highly unfolded and flexible structure.
The E64D mutant spectrum is nearly identical to wild-type, with minimal chemical shift perturbations.
The M26I mutant retains overall fold but shows chemical shift changes beyond the mutation site, indicating structural perturbations.
The A104T mutant retains overall fold but shows chemical shift changes beyond the mutation site, indicating structural perturbations.
The D149A mutant retains overall fold but shows chemical shift changes beyond the mutation site, indicating structural perturbations.

Technical replicates.Description: Steady-state heteronuclear NOE measurements were performed using three pairs of spectra to estimate errors.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a reference for comparison with mutants.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Weighted average of chemical shift changes calculated as [(Dd 1H)2 + (Dd 15N)2/25]1/2/2.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Good dispersion in HSQC spectra similar to wild-type, indicating a well-folded structure.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Poor dispersion in HSQC spectra or significant chemical shift changes indicating structural perturbation.
